column4: I've been trying to get some help with my graphics driver on Ubuntu 11.04 for several days, but no luck so far.  In the "Additional Drivers" tool, my NVIDIA driver has the green dot, yet the tool says "This driver is activated but not currently in use."  Help please.
did you look at your xorg.conf?
No, but I just have looked.  I have a Section "Device" which says Driver "nvidia" and no other Device sections
also check sudo lsmod that lists the loaded modules aka drivers
so it is certainly loaded into the kernel, but it appears X is not using it?
can you run sudo nvidia-xconfig ?
that has added numerous blocks to my xorg.conf file, but restarting the PC still didn't get it to actually use the driver.  The "Additional Drivers" tool still says the same thing
aslo check nvidia-settings
nvidia-settings detects the display and graphics card, and I did a "save" from this program which did modify xorg.conf again, and rebooted again, yet the driver is still not being used.
I dunno then. reinstall the nvidia package? :-/
the nvidia-current one?
Id do all of them that you have installed and have the word nvidia in them :)
boot insto single user mode, install them via apt or aptitude and then just run /etc/init.d/gdm start

Well, removing nvidia-current and rebooting has affected something.  Now the display appears broken and gdm cannot start, but the machine isn't locked up, just the display.  So I guess I'll straighten that out and try installing nvidia-current again.
actually the "failsafe graphics mode" choice in the recovery menu worked, so i am re-installing nvidia-current now and will see what happens in a few minutes.

Same situation after re-installing nvidia-current.  X works but "Additional Drivers" claims the nvidia driver isn't in use, and 3D acceleration is clearly not working because glxgears like doesn't even budge, the system is almost hung when running it, and it claims it is running at 17,000 frames/second, but obviously that's not true
I am trying to kill sound events in fluxbox unsuccessfully.. going for a smoke
I'll probably still be here struggling with X when you come back :)
I can msg you my xorg.conf
sure
success. I am done. I have no idea what I did. I just booted into gnome and then back to flux its the sounds are gone.
